intro: Microcoelia grahamii, commonly known as the Graham's microcoelia, is a small, flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, small, urn-shaped flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with features such as reduced leaf surface area and deep root systems to conserve water. Microcoelia grahamii is often found in rocky soils and is a rare, endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
